title: [Feature Request]: Add support for Mixtral-8x7B-Instruct-v0.1-q4
body:
### Problem Description

Could you, please, add following models to webllm chat?
- https://huggingface.co/mlc-ai/Mixtral-8x7B-Instruct-v0.1-q4f16_1-MLC
- https://huggingface.co/mlc-ai/Mixtral-8x7B-Instruct-v0.1-q4f32_1-MLC

### Solution Description

From my understanding the missing part is [Custom model library](https://llm.mlc.ai/docs/deploy/webllm.html#bring-your-own-model-library) right?  

I can try to do it myself and prepare PR if it is feasible for someone with no understanding of the field, unfortunately I'm not sure if it is possible to do using Intel Macbook.

### Alternatives Considered

It seems like WebLLM(WebGPU) is single viable option to run it on Intel Mac (since mlc-ai is not an option: https://github.com/mlc-ai/mlc-llm/issues/3078).

### Additional Context

_No response_

Adjust Backend Example Repo to be a single code base for one micro service
body:
Previously, we had planned to make this repository the collection of all the backend services we will have. After some review of repo management, versioning, package releases, etc, we've decided to keep each micro service in its own repository.

Please adjust all documentation to reflect the change, and adjust the location of all the micro service code to be in the root directory of the repository instead of in individual directories.

title: FE - School - Admin - Do not have invalid state for OTP input
Create Base Repository Class for CRUD Operations
body:
## Overview
Create a generic base repository class that handles common CRUD operations for all domain entities, interfacing with Supabase database.

## Requirements

### Base Class Features
- **Generic Design**: `BaseRepository<T>` supporting any entity type
- **Async Operations**: All methods return promises
- **Error Handling**: Return data on success, error objects on failure
- **RLS Support**: Handle Row Level Security policies
- **Zod Validation**: Validate data against schemas before database operations
- **Transaction Support**: Per-record transactions for bulk operations
- **Test Support**: Mockable for testing

### Core Methods
- `findAll(options?: QueryOptions)` - Get all records with optional filtering
- `findById(id: string  < /dev/null |  number)` - Get single record by ID
- `create(data: CreateInput)` - Create new record
- `update(id: string | number, data: UpdateInput)` - Update existing record
- `delete(id: string | number)` - Delete record
- `bulkCreate(data: CreateInput[], options?: BulkOptions)` - Bulk insert with per-record transactions
- `bulkUpdate(data: UpdateInput[], options?: BulkOptions)` - Bulk update with per-record transactions

### Loading Strategy Support
- **Lazy Loading**: Default behavior - load entity without relations
- **Eager Loading**: Optional `include` parameter to load related entities
- Support for nested includes (e.g., `include: { equipment_stats: true, required_items: true }`)

### Error Handling
- Return success objects: `{ data: T, error: null }`
- Return error objects: `{ data: null, error: { message: string, code?: string } }`
- Handle database constraint violations gracefully
- Provide meaningful error messages

### Type Safety
- Use existing Supabase generated types from `app/types/supabase.ts`
- Support `Tables`, `TablesInsert`, `TablesUpdate` type patterns
- Generic constraints for type safety

## Implementation Details

### File Location
- Create: `app/repositories/BaseRepository.ts`
- Types: `app/repositories/types.ts`

### Dependencies
- Supabase client from `app/lib/supabase/client.ts`
- Zod for validation
- Existing Supabase types

### Example Usage
```typescript
// Domain-specific repository
class EquipmentRepository extends BaseRepository<'equipment'> {
  constructor() {
    super('equipment', equipmentSchema);
  }
  
  // Custom methods specific to equipment
  async findByQuality(quality: string) {
    return this.findAll({ where: { quality } });
  }
}

// Usage in components
const equipmentRepo = new EquipmentRepository();
const result = await equipmentRepo.findById('sword-of-fire');
if (result.error) {
  // Handle error
} else {
  // Use result.data
}
```

## Testing Requirements
- Unit tests for all base methods
- Mock Supabase client for testing
- Test error scenarios and edge cases
- Test bulk operations with mixed success/failure

## Success Criteria
- [ ] Base repository class created with all required methods
- [ ] Type safety maintained with existing Supabase types
- [ ] Error handling implemented consistently
- [ ] Lazy/eager loading support implemented
- [ ] Bulk operations support per-record transactions
- [ ] Zod validation integrated
- [ ] Unit tests written and passing
- [ ] Documentation with usage examples

## Notes
- This is the foundation for all domain repositories
- Focus on flexibility and type safety
- Keep it generic - domain-specific logic goes in child classes
- Consider performance implications of eager loading

title: ğŸš€ Enhancement(add): Search Functionality to find/view Documents in a Collection
body: ### ğŸ”– Enhancement description ## Summary Navigating through collections with a large number of documents (e.g., 50+) becomes difficult and inefficient, especially when trying to locate a document by its title or content. A search bar or filter functionality to find specific documents within a collection in the Appwrite console would significantly improve user experience and productivity. ## Problem Currently, there is no built-in way to search or filter documents in a database collection via the Appwrite Console UI. This becomes cumbersome when working with large collections, as users are forced to manually scroll and check each document one by one. ## Screenshot ### ğŸ¤ Pitch Add a search or filter bar at the top of the document list in the Console, allowing users to: Search by document ID, title, or other fields Use filters (e.g., exact match, partial match) Optionally support advanced query parameters (e.g., contains, startsWith, etc.) ### ğŸ‘€ Have you spent some time to check if this issue has been raised before? - [x] I checked and didn't find similar issue ### ğŸ¢ Have you read the Code of Conduct? - [x] I have read the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/appwrite/.github/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)

title: Showing range indicators for cities
body:
Hey guys

Would you be interested in seeing a range indicator for cities? 

The way this would work is that by selecting a city a range indicator would appear. Deselecting it in any way would hide it.

This of course would only be visible to you as the selecting player.

This could be helpful for newer players. Pro players already have this down to a science.

It could also only be triggered when the player holdsnon the left alt button, skmilar to how dota 2 uses it to expand descriptions and show extra terrain indicators.

Pointers for myself 

Trigger docs: https://www.hiveworkshop.com/threads/oskey-player-key-event.319903/
Possible circle resource: https://www.hiveworkshop.com/threads/target-and-circle-indicator-tc-vfx.349193/

title: Add an option to set maximum size of batch for OpenAi compatible embedding servers
body:
### What specific problem does this solve?

Some users integrate Roo Code with custom or self-hosted embedding models that impose strict limits on batch size. Currently, Roo Code sends embedding requests in batches of unrestricted size, which works for some providers but breaks with others.

### Current behavior:
- Batch size is arbitrary
- The only restriction is on the maximum number of tokens
- This causes HTTP errors (e.g., 422 or 413) from custom services that cannot handle large batches
- As a result, embedding fails and indexing cannot proceed

### Expected behavior:
- Allow users to configure the maximum number of items per embedding batch. If the value is not provided, batch size should remain unlimited (current behavior).

### Additional context (optional)

_No response_

### Roo Code Task Links (Optional)

_No response_

### Request checklist

- [x] I've searched existing Issues and Discussions for duplicates
- [x] This describes a specific problem with clear impact and context

### Interested in implementing this?

- [x] Yes, I'd like to help implement this feature

### Implementation requirements

- [ ] I understand this needs approval before implementation begins

### How should this be solved? (REQUIRED if contributing, optional otherwise)

_No response_

### How will we know it works? (Acceptance Criteria - REQUIRED if contributing, optional otherwise)

_No response_

### Technical considerations (REQUIRED if contributing, optional otherwise)

_No response_

### Trade-offs and risks (REQUIRED if contributing, optional otherwise)

_No response_

title: Enhancement: Reposition 'Settings Automatically Restored' notification closer to settings dropdown
body:
# Enhancement: Reposition Settings Automatically Restored Notification

## Summary
The "Settings Automatically Restored" notification box should be positioned directly under the settings dropdown instead of below the import files section for better visual association and user understanding.

## Current Behavior
- Settings automatically restored notification appears below the import files box
- Creates visual disconnect between the settings dropdown and the notification
- Users may not immediately associate the notification with the settings they're using
- Notification feels disconnected from the relevant UI element

## Proposed Behavior
- Position the "Settings Automatically Restored" box directly under the settings dropdown
- Create clear visual relationship between settings controls and restoration notification
- Improve information hierarchy and user comprehension
- Maintain existing notification functionality and styling

## User Experience Issue
**Current Layout:**
1. Settings dropdown
2. [other UI elements]
3. Import files section
4. Settings automatically restored notification â† disconnected

**Proposed Layout:**
1. Settings dropdown
2. Settings automatically restored notification â† closely associated
3. [other UI elements]
4. Import files section

## Implementation Details
- Move the settings restoration notification component in the ImportStep layout
- Ensure proper spacing and visual hierarchy
- Maintain responsive design compatibility
- Preserve existing notification behavior and timing

## Benefits
- **Better Information Architecture**: Notification appears near related controls
- **Improved User Understanding**: Clear connection between settings and restoration message
- **Enhanced Visual Flow**: More logical layout progression
- **Reduced Cognitive Load**: Users don't need to search for related information

## Priority: Low
- **Impact**: Minor UI/UX improvement
- **Effort**: Low (primarily layout adjustment)
- **Risk**: Very low (cosmetic change only)

## Implementation Areas
- ImportStep component layout structure
- CSS/styling adjustments for proper spacing
- Responsive design considerations

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] "Settings Automatically Restored" notification appears directly under settings dropdown
- [ ] Proper spacing maintained between notification and surrounding elements
- [ ] Responsive design works correctly on all screen sizes
- [ ] Existing notification functionality preserved
- [ ] Visual hierarchy improved without affecting other UI elements

## Related Components
- ImportStep component
- Settings management UI
- Auto-restore notification system

title: Enhancement: Insert new page groups at top of list for better user feedback
body:
# Enhancement: Insert New Page Groups at Top of List

## Summary
When creating new page groups, they should be inserted above all existing groups rather than below them. This provides immediate visual feedback to users that their group was successfully created.

## Current Behavior
- New page groups are appended to the bottom of the existing groups list
- In large PDFs with many groups, newly created groups are not immediately visible
- Users may not realize their group was successfully created
- Users need to scroll down to find their new group

## Proposed Behavior
- New page groups should be inserted at the top of the groups list
- This provides immediate visual confirmation that the group was created
- Users can immediately see and interact with their new group
- Maintains logical ordering where newest items appear first

## User Experience Problem
With large PDFs containing many pages and groups:
1. User creates a new page group
2. Group is added to bottom of list (below viewport)
3. User doesn't see immediate feedback
4. User may think the action failed
5. User needs to scroll to find the new group

## Proposed Solution
Update the page group creation logic to:
1. Insert new groups at index 0 (top of list)
2. Adjust existing group order values accordingly
3. Ensure proper visual feedback and immediate visibility
4. Maintain existing group management functionality

## Implementation Areas
- Page group creation logic in group management hooks/utilities
- Order value calculation for new groups
- UI list rendering to reflect new insertion order
- Any related sorting or ordering logic

## Benefits
- **Immediate Feedback**: Users instantly see their new group
- **Better UX**: No need to scroll to find newly created groups  
- **Reduced Confusion**: Clear confirmation that group creation succeeded
- **Consistency**: Follows common UI patterns where new items appear at top

## Priority: Medium
- **Impact**: Improves user experience and reduces confusion
- **Effort**: Low to medium (primarily logic adjustment)
- **Risk**: Low (mainly affects insertion order, not core functionality)

## Related Components
- Page group management system
- Multi-file import workflow
- Page organization UI components

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] New page groups appear at the top of the groups list
- [ ] Existing groups maintain their relative order
- [ ] Group ordering values are properly calculated
- [ ] No regression in existing group management functionality
- [ ] Immediate visual feedback when groups are created

title: Enhancement: Change 'Remove Page' behavior to soft removal with restore option
body:
## Enhancement Request

### Current Behavior
- "Remove Page" button permanently removes pages from page group tables
- "Skip page" functionality exists as a separate column/option
- Both features essentially perform the same function of excluding pages from processing

### Proposed Enhancement
1. **Change "Remove Page" to soft removal**: Instead of permanently removing pages, move them to a "Removed Pages" section at the bottom of the Import Step UI
2. **Add restore functionality**: Each removed page should have a "Restore" button to add it back to the active pages
3. **Remove "Skip page" functionality**: Eliminate the Skip page column/functionality since Remove Page will serve the same purpose with better UX
4. **Improve mistake recovery**: Users can easily undo accidental page removals

### Benefits
- **Better UX**: Prevents accidental permanent page removal
- **Simplified interface**: Consolidates two similar functions into one better implementation
- **Mistake recovery**: Users can restore accidentally removed pages without re-importing files
- **Cleaner UI**: Removes redundant "Skip page" functionality

### Implementation Considerations
- Add "Removed Pages" section at bottom of Import Step
- Update page group tables to use soft removal
- Implement restore functionality for removed pages
- Remove Skip page column and related logic
- Update any references to skipped vs removed pages in downstream processing

### Priority
Medium

### Labels
enhancement

title: `Clock In` from Timeline
body:
### âš ï¸ Please check that this feature request hasn't been suggested before.

- [x] I searched previous [Issues](https://github.com/ivan-lednev/obsidian-day-planner/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen) didn't find any similar feature requests.
- [x] I am only requesting a single feature. Multiple changes should be split into individual requests, with links between them.
- [x] I believe my requested feature will be generally applicable to other users, not just me: it is not uniquely tied to my personal workflow.

### ğŸ”– Feature description

Enable users to clock in tasks from right clicking the timeline blocks (same context menu as -> `Reveal task in file`)

### âœ”ï¸ Solution

Add clock in option to timeline's timeblock context menu `right click` (that only has `Reveal task in file`)



### â“ Alternatives

Open file, search for respective task, right click and `clock in`.



### ğŸ“ Additional Context

`Reveal task in file` doesn't work properly when the daily note where the task lies in is a kanban board. It's needed to open the file at markdown mode to be able to do it. A way that all users would have less trouble to clock in tasks, would be to be able to do it right from the timeblocks in the timeline! It would be easier for everyone.


##### Extra attention:

have a button for it when selecting a timeblock (such as the dragging buttons), as in touch devices it's not possible to open the context menu inside the widget without a mouse. (it can be done with long press in core plugin file explorer)

title: Redesign the Data Persistence Layer
body:
The data persistence layer below the Database Context uses static JSON files either created with the build or are loaded dynamically for unit tests. This layer requires a lot of rework in order to...
1. Use a single JSON files as the database.
2. Use a blob-storage-like data store to persist the database.
3. Go from only supporting read-only operations to now supporting write operations.

title: [FEATURE] Add Copy as Rich Text Option to Markdown Editor
body:
## Problem Statement
Users currently cannot easily transfer formatted markdown content to external systems like Jira. They need to manually reformat text when moving content between our application and other platforms that support rich text.

## Proposed Solution
Add a "Copy as Rich Text" option to the markdown editor's context menu ("..." menu) that converts the entire document's markdown to formatted rich text in the clipboard, allowing users to paste formatted content directly into other applications.

## Alternative Solutions
1. Leave as-is (users continue manual reformatting)

## User Experience
The user opens the "..." menu in the markdown editor and clicks the "Copy as Rich Text" option. The entire document is formatted as rich text and copied to the clipboard, ready to paste into applications like Jira.

## Mockups/Examples
Similar functionality exists in these applications:
- Notion: "Copy as HTML" option in the ... menu
- VS Code with Markdown Preview: Right-click on preview and select "Copy as HTML"

## Additional Context
This feature is particularly important for teams that use both our application and Jira for project management, as it would streamline the workflow between the two systems.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] A "Copy as Rich Text" option is visible in the markdown editor's "..." menu
- [ ] The entire document is properly converted to rich text format when copied
- [ ] Copied text can be pasted into Jira with formatting intact (headings, bold, italic, lists, etc.)
- [ ] User receives visual feedback when text has been copied (e.g., a temporary toast notification)
- [ ] Feature works across all supported platforms (Windows, macOS, Linux)

title: Add `Lock` deploy message in `Skipper`
body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem

To safely deploy a `Lock` contract from the frontend, we need the correct `StateInit`
Without it, the frontend can't garantee whether the target `Lock` contract address is already deployed or whether tokens might be sent into the void.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Create a new method in the Skipper contract that deploys Lock contract for specified user.
Its eliminate the need to hardcode contract internals in the frontend.


### Describe alternatives you've considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

title: Enhancement : Need to Add section of Path of Glory in TranspornHarem
[FEATURE] Add App Logo
body:
## Problem Statement
The application currently lacks a distinctive logo that represents its identity and purpose. Without a logo, the app appears less professional and doesn't create instant brand recognition for users. Additionally, we need to ensure proper attribution for any visual assets we use.

## Proposed Solution
Add a distinctive, professional logo to the application that will be displayed in:
- The application window/title bar
- Loading screens
- About page
- Marketing materials

The logo should be accompanied by proper attribution to its creator/source, especially if we're using free or licensed artwork.

## Alternative Solutions
- Create an entirely custom logo in-house
- Use a text-based logo with custom typography
- Commission a professional designer to create a unique logo
- Use an open-source or free logo with appropriate licensing

## User Experience
Users will see the logo whenever they interact with the application. It will create a stronger brand identity and make the application more recognizable. The logo should be appropriately sized and positioned so it doesn't interfere with functionality but remains visible enough to establish brand identity.

## Mockups/Examples
Some examples of effective app logos with proper attribution:
- Firefox browser with Mozilla attribution

## Additional Context
The logo should align with our application's purpose and aesthetic. We should maintain different sizes and resolutions of the logo for various use cases (favicon, app icon, splash screen, etc.).

If we use external resources, we must track the source and license requirements. This could include adding attribution in:
- An "About" page in the app
- Documentation/README
- Credits file in the repository

## Acceptance Criteria
- A professional-looking logo is implemented across the application
- Logo displays correctly at different resolutions and sizes
- Proper attribution is provided according to the source's licensing requirements
- Attribution is visible to users in appropriate locations

title: More detailed information in the Object Lifecycle tab Tracked Object Details
body: **Describe what you are trying to accomplish and why in non technical terms** I want more detailed information about tracked objects to make it easier to set filter values. **Describe the solution you'd like** Some of this information is already in in the Object Lifecycle tab in Tracked Object Details. For example, it contains information about Zones, Ratio, and Area. I'd also like information about the Loitering Time and Object Confidence. In addition, having the Object Lifecycle as a carousel requires a lot of extra clicking. Since most objects have 3 lifecycle items, it would be more convenient if the Object Lifecycle was a scrollable list with a default size of about 4 items. **Describe alternatives you've considered** I do a lot of guess, check, restart. **Additional context**

title: Improve Login Page Design
body:
## ğŸ¨ Design Enhancement Request

### Current State
The login page could benefit from design improvements to enhance user experience and visual appeal.

### Proposed Improvements
- [x] **Modern UI/UX Design**
  - Implement a more modern and clean design language
  - Improve visual hierarchy and spacing
  - Add subtle animations and transitions

- [ ] **Visual Elements**
  - Better color scheme and typography
  - Improved form styling with better input fields
  - Add visual feedback for user interactions
  - Consider adding illustrations or graphics

- [ ] **Responsive Design**
  - Ensure the login page looks great on all device sizes
  - Optimize layout for mobile, tablet, and desktop

- [ ] **Accessibility**
  - Improve contrast ratios for better readability
  - Add proper ARIA labels and focus indicators
  - Ensure keyboard navigation works smoothly

- [ ] **User Experience**
  - Add loading states for authentication
  - Improve error message display
  - Consider adding social login options styling
  - Add "Remember me" and "Forgot password" functionality styling

### Design Inspiration
Consider modern login page designs from:
- GitHub
- Vercel
- Linear
- Other modern SaaS applications

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Login page has a modern, professional appearance
- [ ] Page is fully responsive across all devices
- [ ] Design is consistent with the overall application theme
- [ ] All accessibility standards are met
- [ ] User interactions feel smooth and intuitive

### Labels
`enhancement`, `ui/ux`, `frontend`

title: Allow D&D of worlds into folders for a more intuitive UX
body:
Worlds should be able to be dragged and dropped into a folder in the sidebar, allowing for a more intuitive user experience.

In multi-select, only worlds selected should be able to be dragged, and the dragged world should only display the first world card, with a number indicator on the bottom right to show the number of worlds being dragged.

The folder sidebar should be scrollable while dragging, and show a visual indicator of which folder it is about to drop to.

title: Performance regression test suite
body:
## Description
Based on PR #46 review, we need to establish a performance regression testing suite to monitor and prevent performance degradation.

## Tasks
- [ ] Establish baseline performance metrics
- [ ] Add automated performance monitoring
- [ ] Create performance regression detection

## Context
This improvement was identified during the review of PR #46 to ensure we maintain and improve performance over time.

title: Integration test framework implementation
body:
## Description
Based on PR #46 review, we need to implement a comprehensive integration testing framework to test module interactions beyond unit tests.

## Tasks
- [ ] Design and implement module interaction testing beyond unit tests
- [ ] Create integration test structure and patterns
- [ ] Document integration testing approach

## Context
This improvement was identified during the review of PR #46 as a critical need for ensuring proper module interaction and system-wide behavior.

title: Test Coverage: Concurrent request handling improvements
body:
## Description
Based on PR #46 review, we need to enhance our testing for concurrent request handling and caching behavior.

## Tasks
- [ ] Add tests for request deduplication for identical URLs
- [ ] Test cache consistency under concurrent operations
- [ ] Verify proper request coalescing

## Context
This improvement was identified during the review of PR #46 to ensure our concurrent request handling is robust and efficient.

title: Test Coverage: File system race conditions and error recovery
body:
## Description
Based on PR #46 review, we need to add comprehensive tests for file system operations, race conditions, and error recovery scenarios.

## Tasks
- [ ] Add tests for atomic file operations during concurrent persona creation
- [ ] Test rollback behavior when operations fail midway
- [ ] Add memory leak detection to performance tests

## Context
This improvement was identified during the review of PR #46 to ensure robust file system operations and proper error handling.

title: Test Coverage: Enhanced JSON parsing and cache corruption tests
body:
## Description
Based on PR #46 review, we need to enhance our test coverage for JSON parsing and cache corruption scenarios.

## Tasks
- [ ] Add more malformed JSON edge cases in GitHubClient tests
- [ ] Test behavior when cache returns unexpected data types
- [ ] Add cache state inconsistency scenarios

## Context
This improvement was identified during the review of PR #46 to strengthen our error handling and edge case coverage.

title: Allow to skip specified imports
body:
### Feature request

Skip specified imports by:

```bash
dtsroll --skip=/^@types/better-sqlite3$/
```

Then `import 'better-sqlite3'` will be ignored.

### Motivations

My project depends on `drizzle-orm`, which depends on `better-sqlite3`. Unfortunately, `@types/better-sqlite3` is broken, causing `dtsroll` failure. I'm not using sqlite, `better-sqlite3` is redundant for me. It'll be nice if `dtsroll` can skip specified imports.

### Alternatives

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

### Bugs are expected to be fixed by those affected by it

- [ ] I'm interested in working on this issue

### Compensating engineering work financially will speed up resolution

- [ ] I'm willing to offer financial support

title: Feature Request: Add option for lightweight search results in search_metadata
body:
The search_metadata endpoint currently returns complete table schemas including all column definitions and metadata. For tables with many columns, this can result in response sizes exceeding 20KB per table.

  Feature Request:
  Add an optional parameter to return condensed search results containing only essential metadata for discovery purposes.

  Proposed Implementation:
  A new optional parameter (e.g., verbose=false or full_schema=false) that would return:
  - Table name
  - Fully qualified name
  - Description
  - Href link
  - Database/schema location
  - Basic statistics (row count, column count)

  The full schema would remain available through the get_entity_details endpoint.

  Rationale:
  - Search operations are typically used for discovery, where full schema details aren't immediately needed
  - Large response payloads can cause issues with streaming transports and client-side parsing
  - Separating discovery from detailed inspection aligns with common API patterns

  Example Usage:
  # Discovery search
  search_metadata(query="customer", entity_type="table", limit=10, full_schema=false)

  # Detailed inspection
  get_entity_details(entity_type="table", fqn="db.schema.customer_orders")

  This would maintain backward compatibility while providing a more efficient option for discovery workflows.

title: Bedrock provider optimization for getModel()
body:
### What specific problem does this solve?

getModel() is a high frequent invoke function, in createMessage(), completePrompt(), formatErrorMessage(). Howerver, JSON.parse(JSON.stringify()), and getModelParams() takes heavy activity and make performance poor, should we cosidering caching strategy for this action.

### Additional context (optional)

_No response_

### Roo Code Task Links (Optional)

_No response_

### Request checklist

- [x] I've searched existing Issues and Discussions for duplicates
- [x] This describes a specific problem with clear impact and context

### Interested in implementing this?

- [x] Yes, I'd like to help implement this feature

### Implementation requirements

- [x] I understand this needs approval before implementation begins

### How should this be solved? (REQUIRED if contributing, optional otherwise)

Instance-Level Cache
Add Map<string, ModelConfig> cache per handler instance
Generate cache key from configuration parameters that affect model selection
Cache persists for the lifetime of the handler instance

### How will we know it works? (Acceptance Criteria - REQUIRED if contributing, optional otherwise)

Testing with unit test, and log information in createMessage(), completePrompt(), formatErrorMessage(),making sure model get from cache.

### Technical considerations (REQUIRED if contributing, optional otherwise)

Will improve performance createMessage(), completePrompt(), formatErrorMessage()

### Trade-offs and risks (REQUIRED if contributing, optional otherwise)

it is easily roll back to original impelementation and no other impace on other model provider

title: Renommer Branch en SchoolBranch pour l'emploi du temps
(feat) More storage structure options
body:
### Does it fit the projects scope?

- [x] This is relevant

### Why?

What I like about Note Mark is that the content of notes is saved as plain text on disk. This opens the door for interoperability.

What I like less is the chosen directory structure. Currently the structure from the data directory root is `<first two letters of note UUID>/<note UUID>/note.md`. Without Note Mark's database, it is impossible to know which note belongs to whom.

### Solution?

 What I would like to see is more configuration options for dynamic paths. For example:

`<configurable unique user ID>/<notebook slug>/<note slug>/note.md`

Notice that all these values are unique, preventing duplicate values from occurring. This structure is also compatible with the existing ability to attach assets, since the contents of the note directory is not changed, just its location.

The `configurable unique user ID` should be something that the user configures. Examples include the unique user ID Note Mark generates, a claim from OIDC (such as `sub` or `preferred_username`), etc.

When configured to use the same type of usernames, this will allow access to a user's own "raw" notes through other software, [such as Nextcloud](https://docs.nextcloud.com/server/latest/admin_manual/configuration_files/external_storage_configuration_gui.html#usage-of-variables-for-mount-paths). That would be a great first step in the ability to integrate Note Mark in other software. ğŸ˜ƒ 

### Alternatives?

_No response_

### Extra Context

_No response_

title: Integration with SvelteKit Remote Functions
body:
### Problem/Motivation

SvelteKit has introduced a new concept of "Remote Functions" (specifically the `form` type) as discussed in [sveltejs/kit#13897](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/discussions/13897). These functions aim to provide a type-safe, collocated, and progressively enhanced way to handle server-side data mutations, acting as a SvelteKit-native RPC layer.

Currently, Superforms excels at providing an excellent DX for forms, including validation, progressive enhancement, and data binding. However, with the release of remote functions, there's an opportunity to further streamline the server-side action handling within Superforms, potentially simplifying boilerplate and improving type inference for form actions.

### Proposed Solution/Idea

Explore and design an integration strategy for Superforms to leverage SvelteKit's new remote functions, particularly the `form` type. This could involve:

1.  **Dedicated Handler:** Provide an API within Superforms that allows users to directly bind a Superform to a SvelteKit remote `form` function, reducing the need for explicit `actions.ts` files or manual `fetch` calls for mutations.
2.  **Enhanced Type Inference:** By understanding the types exposed by remote functions, Superforms could potentially offer even more robust and automatic type inference for form data and responses.
3.  **Simplified Mutation Logic:** Abstract away some of the repetitive patterns in `+page.server.ts` or `+page.ts` action handling when remote functions are used for form submissions.

This integration could lead to an even more cohesive and "SvelteKit-native" feel for Superforms users, aligning with SvelteKit's evolving patterns for data handling.

### Benefits

* **Reduced Boilerplate:** Simplify server-side form handling.
* **Improved Type Safety:** Leverage remote functions' strong typing.
* **Enhanced Developer Experience:** More intuitive and integrated approach to form mutations.
* **Future-Proofing:** Align Superforms with SvelteKit's direction for data mutations.

### Relevant Links

* SvelteKit Remote Functions Discussion: [https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/discussions/13897](https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/discussions/13897)

title: Review select interface options --structural and --boundary
body:
The AI has come up with it's own features and implemented two extra select options. These are probably meant to extend selections but the tests for boundary are breaking and --structural has no tests. The interface itself also feels a bit weird, so it might make sense to review it with a user experience mindset and see if this interface could be improved. 

**IMPORTANT**: this issue needs human eyes. Don't trust the AI on it. 

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Review and document current behaviour
- [ ] Suggest improved interface
- [ ] Ask the AI to add tests that document the improved interface (put them on skip)
- [ ] Fix or delete the existing currently skip-ed boundary tests
- [ ] The implementation is updated to the new design and skip-ed tests are not skipped anymore
